result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Abdias Rojas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas appeared by video.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared by video for Juan Abdias Rojas.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing with Defendant's Branch 46Case, 21CF303. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a GLOBAL resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court VACATED Scheduling Conference date of October 27, 2022. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-212022
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas in court.  Attorney Christopher Hartley in court on behalf of Annette E Rauch for Juan Abdias Rojas.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant has a pending matter in Branch 46 that may resolve globally. Defense requests a status conference after the final pretrial date of pending matter to determine if this case will resolve. Court grants request. Court reviews defendant's justice point violation report. Based on the statements made on the record, Court admonished the defendant. Case remains calendared in branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas in court with attorney Christopher Hartley for Annette E Rauch.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Abdias Rojas appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-17-2022

Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Annette Rauch to be appointed to this matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed and filed. 
Attorney Annette Rauch

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE FRANKE, RESERVE JUDGE. 
Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas in Court with Attorney Annette E Rauch.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case called on the record to appoint counsel for Mr. Rojas. Attorney Rauch was appointed by the Court on Mr. Rojas' pending case, 21CF303, in Branch 46. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Annette Rauch to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

<<Attorney Rauch is NOT available for this afternoon's Preliminary hearing. Attorney Rauch will contact Prelim Court to reschedule. Defendant will still appear for today's Preliminary hearing to receive the new date.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court orders ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Juan Abdias Rojas in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Abdias Rojas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
